medical_history.chief_complaint: Diffuse dermal angiomatosis (DDA) of the breast.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began with reticulated erythema which developed into painful plaques over a duration ranging from 3 months to 17 months, with variations in response to previous treatments.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Patients had a history of Takayasu arteritis, secondary stroke, hypertension, multiple deep venous thrombi, pulmonary emboli, peripheral artery disease, and breast reduction surgeries.
medical_history.social_history: Smoking history was present in several patients, with varying amounts. One patient was a never-smoker.
